overview: Wandile is studying at an expensive university in South Africa, dominated by white people. As a black trans person Wandile feels alienated and joins a massive student protest at the university. The students demand decolonization of the university, and soon the protests evolve into a national movement for free education and the end to all forms of repression in the former apartheid state. Suddenly they find themselves the target of attacks by the university leadership, police and army, while internal conflicts threaten to tear the movement apart.
tagline: A massive student protest at the university of Cape Town evolve into a national movement for free education and the end to all forms of repression in the former apartheid state.
title: The Art of Fallism
